title: Role Transformation and Language Education Competency Development Strategies for Remote Language Instruction Faculty

context.prior_knowledge: Basic experience in operating remote education systems, knowledge of language education (four-skill assessment methods, text analysis techniques, integrated grammar-vocabulary strategies), and experience using mobile learning tools.
context.additional_context: Case studies of smartphone-based learning environments applied to language education domains (interactive writing tools, AI pronunciation assessment systems, mobile vocabulary quiz platforms, etc.), including technology integration examples for enhancing learners' reading comprehension and expressive skills.

learning_goals: Explain the five core roles of remote language education instructors (content developer, interaction facilitator, feedback provider, assessment designer, technology integrator) and diagnose role-specific competency gaps in language education (e.g., grammar/vocabulary integration, reading/writing assessment design).

Learners can analyze survey data (minimum 50 responses) to derive five priority areas for developing competencies in digital tool utilization and language education design (e.g., grammar/vocabulary integration, reading/writing assessment) and present weighted results using the AHP hierarchical analysis method.

Design three mobile-optimized language teaching methods (microlearning-based vocabulary training, pronunciation assessment using speech recognition, writing feedback via collaboration platforms) and apply them to project-based assessments (text analysis, expression evaluation, etc.).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
